summary: An email chain from July 2019 discussing concerns about Jeffrey Epstein's behavior while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. A Chief Psychologist from the Bureau of Prisons describes Epstein as 'very entitled and manipulative' and expresses concern he may try to escape.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; described as entitled, manipulative, and a potential escape risk while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist, U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Author of the email describing Epstein's behavior and expressing concern about a potential escape attempt.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist is assessing Epstein's behavior and psychological state while he is in custody.

events.title: Email expressing concerns about Epstein
events.description: An email is sent by a Chief Psychologist describing Epstein as entitled and manipulative and expressing concern he may try to escape from custody.

events.title: Automated 'Voice a Concern' message submitted
events.description: An automated message was generated from the BOP website from a user expressing concern that Epstein may try to get help to escape and that he engages in psychopathic, manipulative behavior.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A Chief Psychologist with the Bureau of Prisons described Jeffrey Epstein as 'very entitled and manipulative' in July 2019.
There was an expressed concern, submitted via the BOP website, that Epstein 'may try to get help to escape' from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The email references a prior meeting where Epstein's behavior was observed and assessed.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY case files (SDNY_00012062).
